item.title: A review on "REWORK"
item.description:
During my last vacation, I have read REWORK by Jason Fried and David Heinemeier Hansson (both founder of Basecamp). Here is what I think about this book.

tl;dr: Holy shit. THIS. THIS. And a thousand times THIS. I love the pragmatism and lets move attitude combined with a provoking writing style. It reminds you how to apply culture and kicks you out of the corporate hamster wheel full of processes and clutter. A book you should read every year. Go, buy, and read it!

item.title: A review on "Atomic Habits: An Easy and Proven Way to Build Good Habits and Break Bad Ones"
item.description:
During my last vacation, I have read Atomic Habits: An Easy and Proven Way to Build Good Habits and Break Bad Ones by James Clear. Here is what I think about this book.

tl;dr: Good book about moving towards your goals with (very) small steps. Various insights into real-life stories, new perspectives, and practical tips on how to destroy bad or establish new habits. Recommended if you like James articles and his style. The book is full of this: Go, buy, and read it.

item.title: A review on "INSPIRED: How to Create Tech Products Customers Love"
item.description:
During my last vacation, i have read INSPIRED: How to Create Tech Products Customers Love by Marty Cagan. Here is what I think about this book.

tl;dr: It is excellent! Highly recommended, especially if you are working in the tech/internet industry, want to develop your product further or to get insights into this complex role. Go, buy, and read it!
